author: Michael Fornabaio
title: Sound Tigers comeback falls short in St. John’s
text:
Sound Tigers comeback falls short in St. John’s By Michael Fornabaio Published 9:44 pm, Saturday, October 24, 2015 
A five-game winning streak to open the Bridgeport Sound Tigers ' season has given way to back-to-back games with five goals allowed. 
The Sound Tigers tied the game twice in the first period, but the St. John's IceCaps scored three in a row and held on for a 5-4 win Saturday at Mile One Centre in St. John's, Newfoundland. 
The teams meet again there Sunday. 
Bridgeport goalie Stephon Williams allowed five goals on 19 shots before giving way to Christopher Gibson , who returned after missing two games injured. 
The Sound Tigers (5-2) scored two goals in the last 9:05. Taylor Beck beat Zach Fucale with James Wright setting a screen in front of the net to cut the IceCaps' lead to 5-3. 
With 3:26 to go, after Alan Quine 's shot went wide on a power play, Joe Whitney retrieved the puck behind the net and banked it in off Fucale. 
Bridgeport couldn't get Gibson off for an extra attacker until about 30 seconds remained, and an icing with 11 seconds left helped seal it for the IceCaps. 
After going 3-for-24 on the power play in the first six games, the Sound Tigers were 2-for-6 Saturday. Bracken Kearns scored on a deflection 5:53 into the game, answering the goal Daniel Carr scored on a breakaway 1:39 in. 
Scott Mayfield tied it a second time at 15:08, his second goal of the young season after scoring only one empty-net goal all last season. But Charles Hudon put St. John's ahead for good with 2:39 left in the first period off a nice pass from Bud Holloway. 
Nikita Scherbak (his first as a pro) and Holloway (off Hudon's setup, returning the favor) scored to put the IceCaps up 5-2 in the second period. 
Bridgeport killed all five IceCaps power plays after giving up nine power-play goals on 29 chances in the first six games. 
IceCaps 5, Sound Tigers 4 
Bridgeport 2 0 2—4 
St. John's 3 2 0—5
